title: Rwrrjoy
author: Rwrrjoy
content: Hi! I'm Nazmul Ahmed Joy, a community moderator with 3 years of expertise in online community moderation and social media management. If you're looking for someone who can manage and moderate your telegram community then look no further. I would love to contribute my skills to help build a thriving and engaged community. Dm me for hire You can check out my resume: https://galaxie.co/p/rwrrjoy-

comments.author: MadHatters
comments.body: It will not be necessary because now there are bot-moderators for free that you can install in the group or in the channel and they are better than they will be watching for 24 hours

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: Quote from: MadHatters on May 13, 2023, 12:07:14 PMIt will not be necessary because now there are bot-moderators for free that you can install in the group or in the channel and they are better than they will be watching for 24 hoursBot moderator only good for filtering normal spam but still nothing beats a real human moderator because there’s some spam that bot moderator can't determine as spam. Also being a moderator is not all about cleaning the chat but answering specific question from members since you can’t setup a bot that knows every question available.Seeing a telegram chat room without a real human bot seems like a dead community to me because the team can’t even hire a stuff to handle simple task instead rely on both with very limited function.

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: Quote from: MadHatters on May 13, 2023, 12:07:14 PMIt will not be necessary because now there are bot-moderators for free that you can install in the group or in the channel and they are better than they will be watching for 24 hoursWhile there are currently moderation bots that can be installed on Telegram, they are not enough, there are lots of things that bots cannot do, such as for example giving organic responses to questions asked by community members and many others. Therefore the community still needs human moderators but still uses bots as moderation.
